skill.name: network-engineering
skill.description: Network architecture, troubleshooting, and infrastructure patterns. Use when designing network topologies, debugging connectivity issues, configuring load balancers, DNS, or implementing network security.
skill.summary: Network architecture, troubleshooting, and infrastructure patterns. Use when designing network topol...
skill.author: Joseph OBrien

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill containing only markdown reference material. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or filesystem modifications. The skill provides educational content for network engineering topics including OSI model, VPC design, load balancing, DNS, and SSL/TLS. All static findings from the pre-computed analysis are false positives - the patterns detected are standard network documentation (private IP examples, command references, protocol explanations) that appear in legitimate technical documentation.

content.value_statement: Network issues cause downtime and security vulnerabilities. This skill provides comprehensive reference guides for network architecture, load balancing, DNS configuration, and SSL/TLS debugging.
actual_capabilities: Reference guides for OSI model layers and protocols
VPC and subnet design patterns with CIDR examples
Load balancer type comparison and health check configuration
DNS record types and debugging commands
SSL/TLS certificate types and configuration best practices
Network troubleshooting checklist and diagnostic commands
limitations: Provides reference information only, does not execute network commands
Does not configure or modify actual network infrastructure
No integration with cloud provider APIs or network devices

use_cases.title: Design VPC Architecture
use_cases.description: Plan VPC CIDR blocks, public and private subnets across availability zones for cloud deployments.

use_cases.title: Debug Connectivity Issues
use_cases.description: Diagnose network connectivity problems using systematic troubleshooting checklists and command references.

use_cases.title: Configure Load Balancers
use_cases.description: Set up application and network load balancers with proper health checks and routing strategies.

prompt_templates.title: OSI Model Lookup
prompt_templates.prompt: What protocols and troubleshooting tools are used at OSI Layer [number]?

prompt_templates.title: Design VPC
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a VPC with public subnets for load balancers, private subnets for application servers, and isolated subnets for databases. Include CIDR ranges.

prompt_templates.title: Debug DNS
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I troubleshoot DNS resolution issues? Show commands to query specific record types and check propagation.

prompt_templates.title: SSL Certificate Help
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain the difference between DV, OV, and EV SSL certificates. Show commands to check certificate expiration and chain.

output_examples.input: Design a VPC for a three-tier web application
output: Traffic Flow: Internet â†’ ALB (public) â†’ App (private) â†’ DB (isolated)
Add NAT Gateway for private subnet outbound access

output_examples.input: Debug SSL certificate issues on my web server
output: Check certificate: openssl s_client -connect hostname:443 -servername hostname
View certificate chain: openssl s_client -connect hostname:443 -showcerts
Check expiration: echo | openssl s_client 2>/dev/null | openssl x509 -noout -dates
Verify TLS versions: openssl s_client -tls1_2 and openssl s_client -tls1_3

output_examples.input: Why is my application not responding on port 80
output: 1. Check if port is listening: netstat -tlnp | grep :80

best_practices: Use separate security groups for each tier (web, app, database)
Apply least privilege principles to security group rules
Set appropriate TTL values based on record change frequency
anti_patterns: Using overlapping CIDR ranges across VPCs
Disabling health checks on load balancers

faq.question: Which load balancer type should I choose?
faq.answer: Use ALB for HTTP/HTTPS with path routing, NLB for TCP/UDP with static IP, and Gateway for third-party appliances.

faq.question: What is the recommended TTL for DNS records?
faq.answer: Static content: 86400 seconds (1 day). Dynamic content: 300 seconds (5 minutes). Failover records: 60 seconds.

faq.question: Does this skill connect to network devices?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides reference guides only. It does not execute commands or connect to any network infrastructure.

faq.question: Is my network data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only reads its own documentation. No network requests are made and no data leaves your system.

faq.question: Why is my application not responding?
faq.answer: Check physical layer, security groups, NACLs, route tables, DNS resolution, and application listening status in that order.

faq.question: How does this compare to cloud provider documentation?
faq.answer: This skill provides general patterns and commands. Use AWS, Azure, or GCP documentation for cloud-specific configurations.
